title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1: STRENGTHEN EDUCATION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child to access Early Child Development (ECD) and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2 EVERY CHILD LEARNS : Girls and boys and adolescents in LAC benefit from equitable, inclusive and relevant Early Child Development (ECD) and education programmes and policies, fostering their full development in the early years, on-time enrollment, transitions, and completion as well as their learning and skills development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child toaccess ECD and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts.

description.narrative: All countries in the region have been supported in their education response to COVID-19; the safe return to school of students; as well as improving quality and relevance of education. Special emphasis was placed on digital education policies, digital learning solutions as the LP, alternative education programmes inclusive education for children with disabilities, intercultural bilingual education, and education for children on the move. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/02/2022

title.narrative: of COs supported in ensuring the continuity of learning during COVID-19 for pre-primary, primary and secondary education, Number
Number of Countries developing Gender-Responsive Education Sector Plans with UNICEF standards.(69205)

Number of countries with plans, strategies and programmes to improve school access, retention and learning outcomes of children on the move, based on international standards, with UNICEF support(69206)

Number of countries with national plans, strategies and programmes to prevent school dropouts; improve school access, retention, progression and completion at all educational level and for re-enrollment of OOSC and adolescents with UNICEF support(69204)

Number of countries with inter-sectoral and inter-agency coordination mechanisms to promote policies and mechanisms of preparedness and rapid responses to guarantee education services for children affected by emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts with the support of UNICEF(69297)
